alert.note: Alert for Modoc County; Northeast Siskiyou and Northwest Modoc Counties (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: High Wind Watch issued December 31 at 2:53PM PST until January 04 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Southwest winds 35 to 50 mph with gusts up to 80 mph possible. * WHERE...Northeast Siskiyou and Modoc County in California, and Klamath and Lake County in Oregon, including Bly, Lakeview, Summer Lake, Paisley, Fort Rock, Valley Falls, Lakeview, Adel, Davis Creek, and portions of highways 31, 140, and 395. * WHEN...From Sunday afternoon through Tuesday morning, with the strongest winds expected Monday afternoon through Monday night. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds could result in tree damage and downed power lines. Travel could become difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. Loose and unsecured items may be blown away or damaged. Visibilities could be significantly reduced due to blowing and drifting snow. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation. Dangerous driving conditions are possible, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Downed trees and power lines are possible. Fasten loose objects or shelter objects in a safe location prior to the onset of winds.

area.areaDesc: Modoc County; Northeast Siskiyou and Northwest Modoc Counties
